intro: Koanophyllon hammatocladum, commonly known as the spinyleaf bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs and have a spiny appearance, which helps reduce water loss and deter herbivores. The showy blue to purple flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
